sn36.11:1.1: Then a mendicant went up to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and said to him:
sn36.11:1.2: “Just now, sir, as I was in private retreat this thought came to mind.
sn36.11:1.3: The Buddha has spoken of three feelings.
sn36.11:1.5: These are the three feelings the Buddha has spoken of.
sn36.11:1.6: But the Buddha has also said:
sn36.11:1.8: What was the Buddha referring to when he said this?”
sn36.11:2.2: I have spoken of these three feelings.
sn36.11:2.4: These are the three feelings I have spoken of.

sn36.11:2.15: But I have also explained the progressive cessation of conditions.
sn36.11:2.16: For someone who has attained the first absorption, speech has ceased.
sn36.11:2.17: For someone who has attained the second absorption, the placing of the mind and keeping it connected have ceased.
sn36.11:2.18: For someone who has attained the third absorption, rapture has ceased.
sn36.11:2.19: For someone who has attained the fourth absorption, breathing has ceased.
sn36.11:2.20: For someone who has attained the dimension of infinite space, the perception of form has ceased.
sn36.11:2.21: For someone who has attained the dimension of infinite consciousness, the perception of the dimension of infinite space has ceased.
sn36.11:2.22: For someone who has attained the dimension of nothingness, the perception of the dimension of infinite consciousness has ceased.
sn36.11:2.23: For someone who has attained the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception, the perception of the dimension of nothingness has ceased.
sn36.11:2.24: For someone who has attained the cessation of perception and feeling, perception and feeling have ceased.
sn36.11:2.25: For a mendicant who has ended the defilements, greed, hate, and delusion have ceased.
sn36.11:2.26: And I have also explained the progressive stilling of conditions.
sn36.11:2.27: For someone who has attained the first absorption, speech has stilled.
sn36.11:2.28: For someone who has attained the second absorption, the placing of the mind and keeping it connected have stilled. …
sn36.11:2.29: For someone who has attained the cessation of perception and feeling, perception and feeling have stilled.
sn36.11:2.30: For a mendicant who has ended the defilements, greed, hate, and delusion have stilled.
sn36.11:2.31: There are these six levels of tranquility.
sn36.11:2.32: For someone who has attained the first absorption, speech has been tranquilized.
sn36.11:2.33: For someone who has attained the second absorption, the placing of the mind and keeping it connected have been tranquilized.
sn36.11:2.34: For someone who has attained the third absorption, rapture has been tranquilized.
sn36.11:2.35: For someone who has attained the fourth absorption, breathing has been tranquilized.
sn36.11:2.36: For someone who has attained the cessation of perception and feeling, perception and feeling have been tranquilized.
sn36.11:2.37: For a mendicant who has ended the defilements, greed, hate, and delusion have been tranquilized.”
